black_beans.name: Black Beans
healthBenefits: Excellent source of fiber for digestive health
High in folate for cell growth and DNA synthesis
Rich in plant-based protein
Good source of iron for oxygen transport
Supports heart health with potassium and magnesium
Low glycemic index for stable blood sugar
Anti-inflammatory antioxidants
preparationTips: Rinse canned beans to reduce sodium by 40%
Soak dried beans overnight to reduce cooking time
Add bay leaf and cumin while cooking for flavor
Pressure cook for 25-30 minutes if using dried
Store cooked beans in fridge for up to 5 days
pairingsSuggestions: Lime and cilantro for Mexican dishes

heart_health.reasoning: Exceptional fiber (15g), potassium (611mg), and magnesium (120mg) support cardiovascular function. Zero cholesterol and minimal saturated fat. High folate reduces homocysteine levels.

blood_sugar.reasoning: Very low glycemic index (30) and glycemic load (12) with 15g fiber slows glucose absorption. High protein and complex carbs provide sustained energy without spikes.

gut_health.reasoning: Outstanding fiber content (15g per cup) feeds beneficial gut bacteria. Resistant starch acts as prebiotic. Supports regular bowel movements and microbiome diversity.

anti_inflammatory.reasoning: Inflammation score of -8 indicates strong anti-inflammatory properties. Rich in antioxidants including anthocyanins. Magnesium and omega-3 reduce inflammatory markers.

brain_health.reasoning: High folate (256mcg) supports neurotransmitter synthesis. Magnesium and iron support cognitive function. Complex carbs provide steady glucose for brain energy.

bone_health.reasoning: Good magnesium (120mg) and calcium (46mg) content. Iron (3.6mg) supports bone matrix. Adequate protein for bone structure maintenance.

immune_support.reasoning: Rich in zinc and iron for immune cell function. High fiber supports gut immunity. Folate essential for immune cell production. Antioxidants combat oxidative stress.

energy_vitality.reasoning: Excellent iron (3.6mg) for oxygen transport. Complex carbs and protein provide sustained energy. B vitamins support energy metabolism. Low GI prevents energy crashes.

weight_management.reasoning: High fiber (15g) and protein (15.2g) promote satiety with only 227 calories. Low fat (0.9g) and sugar (0.3g). High nutrient density supports healthy weight loss.

longevity.reasoning: Associated with reduced mortality in Blue Zone diets. High antioxidants combat cellular aging. Fiber supports longevity markers. Anti-inflammatory properties reduce chronic disease risk.

beans.name: Pinto Beans
healthBenefits: Exceptional fiber for digestive and heart health

Rich plant-based protein for muscle maintenance
Potassium supports healthy blood pressure
Low glycemic impact for blood sugar control

kidney_beans.name: Kidney Beans
healthBenefits: Very low glycemic index for excellent blood sugar control
Highest iron content among common beans
Rich fiber supports heart and digestive health
High potassium for blood pressure regulation
Folate supports cell growth and pregnancy health
Plant-based protein for muscle maintenance
Antioxidants reduce inflammation and oxidative stress
preparationTips: CRITICAL: Never eat raw - contains toxic lectin phytohaemagglutinin
Boil dried beans vigorously for 10 minutes before simmering
Soak overnight and discard soaking water before cooking
Canned beans are fully cooked and safe to eat
Pressure cook dried beans for 25-30 minutes at high pressure
pairingsSuggestions: Corn and vegetables for three-bean salad
Onions and spices for rajma curry

garbanzo_beans.name: Garbanzo Beans (Chickpeas)
healthBenefits: Rich in plant-based protein and fiber
High folate supports pregnancy and cell health
Excellent iron for energy and immune function
Low glycemic index for blood sugar control
Healthy fats including omega-3 fatty acids
Calcium and magnesium for bone health
Versatile for hummus, salads, and curries
preparationTips: Soak dried chickpeas 8-12 hours before cooking
Add baking soda to soaking water to soften skins
Pressure cook for 35-40 minutes if using dried
Save aquafaba (cooking liquid) as egg substitute
Roast for crispy snack at 400°F for 30 minutes
pairingsSuggestions: Olive oil and herbs for roasted chickpeas

lentils.name: Lentils
healthBenefits: Highest protein content among legumes (17.9g)
Exceptional folate - highest among all beans
Excellent iron source for plant-based diets
Outstanding fiber for digestive and heart health
Quick-cooking compared to other legumes
Very high in potassium for heart health
Low glycemic index for blood sugar stability
preparationTips: No soaking required - ready in 15-30 minutes
Red lentils cook fastest (10-15 minutes)
Green/brown lentils hold shape best for salads
Add aromatics and spices while cooking
Rinse before cooking to remove debris
Use 3:1 water to lentil ratio
pairingsSuggestions: Rice for complete protein (dal and rice)
Lemon and herbs for Mediterranean salads
